intro: Galium scabrellum, commonly known as rough-stemmed bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium scabrellum is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is known for its ability to spread via rhizomes.
